text: Thompson Falls is a city in Montana in the United States. It is the county seat of Sanders County. As of the 2020 United States Census, there were 1,336 people. Thompson Falls was named after British explorer, geographer and fur trader David Thompson. He founded a North West Company fur trading post. The town is next to natural waterfalls on the Clark Fork river. Thompson Falls was established in 1910. ==References== Category:Cities in Montana Category:County seats in Montana Category:1910s establishments in Montana Category:1910 establishments in the United States
title: Thompson Falls, Montana
